page.title: 03TRANSPORT LINKS-HORBURY
page.content: The Horbury and South Osset area was able to develop in the nineteenth century due to good canal,road,and rail links with the rest of the industrial north. Today the success of the area owes much to the excellent communications.The local railway station closed in 1970,(Wakefield has two stations) and the canal no longer plays a significant role,but the location of two motorway intersections nearby has undoubtedly attracted industry into the area and allowed local people to commute easily to jobs in West and South Yorkshire.In fact,the intersection between the M1 and M62,has helped the area claim to be the "crossroads of the North",a position it last held in the great coaching days of the eighteenth century.
